page.title: 05CHANGING TIMES
page.content: There have been many changes in our area in the last twenty years. The High Street is very different. There was an ABC Cinema where Safeways is now, the market was the site of old shops in character with the area, the Victorian Police Station was replaced by a bigger, modern building. Many old shops no longer exist. Part of the High Street is pedestrianised with benches and flower tubs. The offices of Honeywell and the garage were built after houses were demolished. Supermarkets like the Co-op have been built with car parks behind them. Some of the old pubs have been demolished and replaced. A new housing estate has been built at the Lyndhurst. It is no longer safe to go out at night as muggings and attacks are more common in the area.
